programme.title: Gore Vidal: The United States of Amnesia
programme.desc: Filmmaker Nicholas Wrathall examines the life and career of the late author with numerous TV clips and interviews with Vidal's contemporaries, such as journalist Robert Scheer.

programme.title: Roseanne for President!
programme.desc: Comedian Roseanne Barr tests the limits of the two-party system as she vies for candidacy on the 2012 ballot.

programme.title: Time Out of Mind
programme.desc: A homeless man (Richard Gere) bonds with a new friend (Ben Vereen) at New York's Bellevue Hospital while trying to repair his relationship with his estranged daughter (Jena Malone).

programme.title: Take Every Wave
programme.desc: Filmmaker Rory Kennedy provides an account of the career of big wave surfer Laird Hamilton, a man who has spent his life conquering untamable walls of water.

programme.title: Sorry, Haters
programme.desc: A Muslim cabbie (Abdellatif Kechiche) is suspicious of an American woman's (Robin Wright Penn) motives when she insists on trying to help his jailed brother.

programme.title: Viceroy's House
programme.desc: In 1947, British statesman Lord Mountbatten serves as India's last Viceroy and is charged with handing India back to its people.

programme.title: Color of a Brisk and Leaping Day
programme.desc: A Chinese-American train buff's (Peter Alexander) passion to revive a defunct rail line alienates him from loved ones in postwar California.

programme.title: Viceroy's House
programme.desc: In 1947, British statesman Lord Mountbatten serves as India's last Viceroy and is charged with handing India back to its people.

programme.title: Official Secrets
programme.desc: A British intelligence officer turns into a whistleblower after learning about NSA espionage plans designed to ensure passage of a resolution of war against Iraq by the U.N. Security Council in 2003.

programme.title: Enemies of the State
programme.desc: An average American family becomes entangled in a bizarre web of espionage and corporate secrets when the U.S. government targets the family's hacker son.

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: Filmmaker Errol Morris studies the 1976 slaying of a Dallas policeman, from different points of view.

programme.title: King Georges
programme.desc: French chef Georges Perrier tries to keep his internationally renowned restaurant relevant in the new culinary world.

programme.title: Radio Bikini
programme.desc: The U.S. government removes Bikini islanders from their homes to test the atomic bomb in 1946.

programme.title: Gore Vidal: The United States of Amnesia
programme.desc: Filmmaker Nicholas Wrathall examines the life and career of the late author with numerous TV clips and interviews with Vidal's contemporaries, such as journalist Robert Scheer.
